ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: COMMAND='command-to-sqoop' 
      
Specifies the Apache Sqoop command. Here is how you must specify the command: 

  SQOOP-command --option … --option

Syntax: DBPWD='database-password' 
      
Specifies the database password that is associated with the DBUSER option.

Syntax: DBUSER='database-user-name' 
      
Specifies the database user name to use for import or export.

Syntax: HADOOPPWD='hadoop-password' 
      
Specifies the Hadoop password that is associated with the HADOOPUSER= option.

Syntax: HADOOPUSER='hadoop-user-name' 
      
Specifies the Hadoop user name to use for import or export.

Syntax: OOZIEURL='oozie-URL' 
      
Specifies the URL to the Oozie server.

Specifies that, if an Oozie workflow file exists as specified by the location in WFHDFSPATH, it 
should be deleted. The SQOOP procedure then creates a new workflow file at that location.

Syntax: JOBTRACKER='job-tracker-URL'
      
Specifies the URL to the JobTracker or ResourceManager services. 

Default: SAS_HADOOP_CONFIG_PATH determines the value for this option if you do not specify one.

Syntax: NAMENODE='name-node-URL' 
      
Specifies the URL to the NameNode services. 

Default: SAS_HADOOP_CONFIG_PATH determines the value for this option if you do not specify one.

Syntax: PASSWORDFILE='password-file' 
      
Specifies the name of the file that is located in HDFS that contains the database password for import 
or export. This separate password file must exist before you can run this procedure, and care should 
be taken to keep this file secure.

Syntax: WFHDFSPATH='Oozie-workflow-path-and-filename' 
      
Specifies the path and filename for where to upload the Oozie workflow, as shown below. 

  /user/myID/mydir/myfile.xml
